Bounding pulses and pale complexion suggest that there is increased blood volume, which may be due to the body trying to compensate for the anemia. Type I hypersensitivity reactions typically involve IgE antibodies, and do not explain the patient's symptoms. Type III reactions involve immune complexes that deposit in tissues, and do not typically cause anemia. Type IV reactions involve T cells and are not relevant in this scenario.
